intro: Millettia cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese tamarind tree, is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The tree produces long, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds surrounded by a fibrous, acidic pulp. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in both natural and cultivated environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and agricultural contexts.
